page.title: 15Pidgeon House Farm Continued
page.content: Most of the food which the cows eat is grass.In the summer they go out into the fields.In the winter the cows eat grass in the form of hay and silage. The farmer thinks that silage is best for the cows,and he grows special grass for making into silage.He puts fertilizer on the grass costing Â£140 a tonne.He buys in cattle cake for the cows at Â£150 a tonne.Because he does not grow cereal crops he buys in straw from his neighbours at around Â£75 a tonne.This family farm is like a factory.In 1985 the farmer is only allowed by law to produce a certain amount of milk.Although when asked, this farmer said that he would like to produce more milk,he felt it unlikely that he would change to some other kind of farming.
